result.execSummary:
All charges against Tomika N Pridgeon in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Tomika N Pridgeon is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in court with attorney Meera L Al-Henaey.  Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in custody.  William Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense moves to Dismiss. State does not object.   Upon motion of Defense, Court ordered case DISMISSED.

per email from defense counsel. Defendant no longer waiving extradiction and request an earlier date.

Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Tomika N Pridgeon in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tomika N Pridgeon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45 Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of rights and right to file a Writ of Habeas Corpus.  Court found the defendant is the person wanted in the State of Texas.
Defendant contested extradition.  Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
